TypeSignature.Value: public delegate void RoleManagerEventHandler(object sender, RoleManagerEventArgs e);
.class public auto ansi sealed RoleManagerEventHandler extends System.MulticastDelegate

Docs.param: A object that contains the event data.
Docs.summary: Defines the delegate for the event of the class.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The RoleManagerEventHandler delegate is defined for the <xref:System.Web.Security.RoleManagerModule.GetRoles> event of the <xref:System.Web.Security.RoleManagerModule> class. You can access the <xref:System.Web.Security.RoleManagerModule.GetRoles> event of the <xref:System.Web.Security.RoleManagerModule> class in the Global.asax file for your ASP.NET application as shown in the example for this topic.
You can use the RoleManagerEventHandler to replace the creation of the <xref:System.Web.Security.RolePrincipal> object by the <xref:System.Web.Security.RoleManagerModule> with your own custom object. To do this, define a delegate using the RoleManagerEventHandler and assign it to the <xref:System.Web.Security.RoleManagerModule.GetRoles> event of the <xref:System.Web.Security.RoleManagerModule>.
## Examples The following example shows the <xref:System.Web.Security.RoleManagerModule.GetRoles> event included in the Global.asax file for an ASP.NET application. The <xref:System.Web.Security.RoleManagerModule.GetRoles> event adds a trace notification for an application where trace is enabled in the Web.config file.
[!code-cs[System.Web.Security.RoleManagerModule#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.web.security.ro_0_1.asax)] [!code-vb[System.Web.Security.RoleManagerModule#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.web.security.ro_0_1.asax)]
